time

Current time is: Wed Feb  9 20:45:35 2005 EST.

It is now 6:33 pm on the 22nd day of the 6th month in the year 319.

You have been adventuring for 21 mins, 15 secs this session.

l
>[Garden, Dragon Cavern.]

The bottleneck widens gradually to reveal a dank underground grotto awash in an otherworldly glow. Drooping tendrilled fungi splotch the striated sandstone cavern ceiling. The thick stalks of the fungi are topped with a head of hundreds of filaments that end with a glowing lavender nodule, giving the entire chamber an eldritch luminescence. A thick carpet of lush burgundy moss blankets the ground and runs up the walls in several instances, thinning into sparse clumps the higher it goes. Where the moss stops its climb, bone-white shelf fungi replaces it; each successive layer jutting further out into the tunnel until reaching the ceiling. Growing in no discernable manner on top of the moss are billowy balloon mushrooms, each easily four feet in radius. Their diaphanous membranes show millions of spores waiting to be exhaled out a small mouth if disturbed. Rounding out the fungal flora are several groups of seven foot tall toadstools, each displaying a dazzling array of shifting fluorescence on their caps.   A large oval sandstone hole in the wall is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (seated), Beauty the Secian, Raen the Draco (seated), Kinverati the Draco, Kiki the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above ground), Weldoian the Noble Secian (seated and holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco (seated), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake (seated), Kavita the Noble Secian, Magenta the Noble Secian (seated), Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (seated), Ying the Drake, and Bodhi the Drake.
Obvious exits: southeast.
>

[Garden, Dragon Cavern.]

The bottleneck widens gradually to reveal a dank underground grotto awash in an otherworldly glow. Drooping tendrilled fungi splotch the striated sandstone cavern ceiling. The thick stalks of the fungi are topped with a head of hundreds of filaments that end with a glowing lavender nodule, giving the entire chamber an eldritch luminescence. This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (seated), Beauty the Secian, Raen the Draco (seated), Kinverati the Draco, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Kiki the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying beside you), Weldoian the Noble Secian (seated and holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco (seated), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake (seated), Kavita the Noble Secian, Magenta the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (seated), Ying the Drake, and Bodhi the Drake.

l
The area brightens.
>[Cylindrical Tunnel.]

The walls of this sloping tunnel are unlike any other found in the network of caverns. Certain sections of the normally porous sandstone are glossy, almost glass-like. Other parts of the passage appear to have melted and bubbled, leaving behind small craters and fist sized lumps in the rock face. The floor is smooth like red-streaked obsidian, seared by the intense heat that can only be generated by dragon flame.   A round carved sandstone tunnel mouth and a narrow black opening are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go tun
>[Circular Pit, Dragon Cavern.]

A winding tunnel opens above a large depression in the cavern floor. A wide ledge spirals its way down the contour of the circular pit, narrowing as it approaches the flat bed of the bottom. The upper concentric circles of the ledge accommodate several rocks. The large rocks are not made of the abundant sandstone of the caves; rather, they are chiseled obsidian. Most have narrow slits for claw perches, while some are crudely hewn into bowl shapes for seating. Sound reverberates magnificently within the bowl, causing any sound above a whisper to carry to any point in the chamber.   A ledge winding downward, a giant glossy black obsidian rock, a giant glossy black obsidian rock, a slick mottled obsidian bowl-shaped rock, a slick mottled obsidian bowl-shaped rock, and a round carved sandstone tunnel mouth are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north.
n
n
>[Basin Rim, Dragon Cavern.]

A steep ramp of tightly packed clay, rocks, and detritus descends into a deep basin formed in the sandstone floor of the cavern. The smooth floor of the basin implies natural formation, but deep claw gouges along the sides, although smoothed by the passage of time, bespeak draconic assistance. From the rim of the basin a phantasmal form is visible. Standing perfectly still at the center of the basin it appears statuesque. A sudden flurry of graceful yet precise movement reveals the apparition to be progressing through a series of increasingly complex fighting stances and maneuvers. Each sharp jab, stab, slash, and cut is demonstrated wielding a gleaming scimitar in one hand and a short curved dagger in the other.   A ramp leading down is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Draffut the Drake.
Obvious exits: north east south* west*.
[Cavern Entrance.]

By swift passage of flood waters, or slow percolating of artesian wells, the towering walls of this sandstone cavern were eroded into eery eliptical shapes, creating an underground network of winding passages. Dozens of misshapen tunnels, chambers, and alcoves start or end in this cavern, their inky black mouths dotting the walls in every direction and height. Apertures in the uneven ground plunge thousands of feet through dripping mists and down into the dark bowels of the earth. Lining the cavern mouth exiting to the forested path are two precisely carved semicircles, one within the other. Their borders are cut several inches deep into the walls and the sandstone has been reinforced with a metallic substance within the double arch. Filling the gaps between the dual arches are deeply gouged draconic runes, glyphs, and wards, each crackling with pent-up azure energy.  A massive stone cavern opening is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south*.
s

go cav
[Forest path.]

The towering trees of the forest begin their ascension of the large mountain seen from the open plains of New South Lake. The root holds are precarious, as the mountain's face is especially steep on the northern side. The muddy path concludes in front of a sheer stone wall covered with verdant patches of green moss. A numbing breeze blows outward from the depths a massive cavern mouth, as if the mountain itself was exhaling ice-chilled breath. Deep-cut symbols grace the sides of the cavern entrance. They appear to be recently completed, as time, water, and weather have not yet dulled the sharp lines of the cuts.  A massive stone cavern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northwest*.
link on the way
>
nw
>[Forest path.]

A wide, shallow sheet of water forms as two shallow streams join in the gully that accompanies the forest path. A kingfisher watches the shallows with hungered interest; several dragonflies skim the water, while water striders skate along the its surface. The soaring oak, ash, and pine trees do a fair, but not complete, job of blocking the jutting mountain to the south.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast*.
ne
>[Forest path.]

The shall stream that serves as the trail's guide is lazy, taking its time. The water murmurs softly to itself as it stumbles over mossy stones and slides beneath large sentinel oaks and pines. The season's leaves decorate the stream's ripples, their greens and browns dappled with shadow and the bit of light allowed to pass through the canopy.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.
nw
nw
>
[Forest path.]

The forest path follows a muddy gully eroded by a shallow stream. Tall pine and oak trees tower above both sides of the muddy banks. Large mossy stones force the stream to twist and turn as it flows slowly south. The ground seems to be sloping downward slightly as the stream cuts back to the southeast.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast*.

[Forest path.]

A fallen tree blocks the path, but it is easily circumvented. On the south side lies a small gully and stream flowing east to southwest. It is hard to tell if the path follows the stream or heads back into the trees.  Some glowing enchanted twinkling diamond candles are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lioness.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* southwest*.
n
>[Forest path.]

The forest path requires constant twisting and turning to navigate undeterred through the obstacle course of fallen trunks, thick spider webs, and lush fern and ivy growth. Though not obvious at first glance, a game trail does indeed snake its way through the rotting leaves and pine needles that make up the padded forest floor. A bright red cardinal, frightened by your sudden presence, takes wing and quickly vanishes, consumed by thick greenery all around.  Some glowing enchanted twinkling diamond candles are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* northwest*.
nw
>[Forest path.]

An ever-present breeze rustles the leaves of the old, ominous oak trees that the forest path meanders through. A few tall pine trees are sprinkled throughout the expanse of oaks, contributing their needles and cones to the ocassional forest shower of wind dislodged debris. The path continues into the forest to the south, its serpentine nature lending to the ancient forest a means to disguise the final destination.  A path and some glowing enchanted twinkling diamond candles are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast*.
go pa
>[Plains along forest.]

The open plains stretch out endlessly to the north of you.  Gentle breezes cause the sea of grass to ripple and roll like the ocean deep.  A tall, solid mass of trees blocks any attempt to travel south.  A river has cut off travel to the east.  A lake, a path, and a muddy trail are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Plains along forest.]

The remains of hundreds of camp fires stretch out along the edge of a massive solid block of trees that block further movement to the south. The ground here is beaten down and muddy, it looks like a very large group passed through here not long ago.

[Plains along river.]

Across the river to your north, the sturdy stockade of Meetpoint rises up to greet you. Though a blight on the serene plains all around it, many travelers take heart at the town walls.

This area is illuminated.

>[Plains along river.]

The river curves to the southwest as it bends around a dark, artificial shape on its far side. The level plains to the southeast make the wooden structures there seem much grander than they deserve.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* southwest*.

>[Southern Tradeway.]

The bridge just north of you crosses over a narrow, fast-moving river to a walled settlement on the other side. The main tradeway heads off to the southwest, a narrow ribbon cutting across the plains.  A stone bridge is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
go bri
>[Bridge]

With Meetpoint at your heels this rugged old cobblestone bridge leads to the Southern Plains and the main trade routes from spur and Meetpoint to the Southernmost reaches of the lands. Signs that this road was once well traveled by the hustle and bustle of laden carts are plain to view. Though, with the hardened clay-like mud and the fact that it has not rained here in some time it is obvious that these tracks are very old.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Meetpoint gate.]

A few guards do a roving patrol of the area and down to the bridge. They check the caravans before they enter and anyone that looks suspicious they throw into the river. They seem quite wary of anyone coming or going to and from the city. From their appearance it would seem best to stay on their good sides and hope that they are in good moods.  An open large sturdy wooden gate, a stone bridge, and a floating pontoon bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Ricochet the Secian (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: None.
go gate
>[Meetpoint.]

Here a gate leads out of the fort and into the Southern regions. Several children run and play just inside the gate, under the watchful eyes of the guards. What was once a very well used trade route has slowed to some caravans bringing supplies for the townsmen and the occasional merchants traveling from the far southern reaches of the land. Many guards protect this section of the fort as it is home to some wild beasts that live outside these walls. In the distance, you can make out two more guards hunting the frogmen that often try to attack the city and caravans.  An open large sturdy wooden gate and a glowing wrought iron lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* northwest*.
go gate

[Forest path.]

An ever-present breeze rustles the leaves of the old, ominous oak trees that the forest path meanders through. A few tall pine trees are sprinkled throughout the expanse of oaks, contributing their needles and cones to the ocassional forest shower of wind dislodged debris. The path continues into the forest to the south, its serpentine nature lending to the ancient forest a means to disguise the final destination.  A path and some glowing enchanted twinkling diamond candles are here.

[Forest path.]

The forest path requires constant twisting and turning to navigate undeterred through the obstacle course of fallen trunks, thick spider webs, and lush fern and ivy growth. Though not obvious at first glance, a game trail does indeed snake its way through the rotting leaves and pine needles that make up the padded forest floor. A bright red cardinal, frightened by your sudden presence, takes wing and quickly vanishes, consumed by thick greenery all around.  Some glowing enchanted twinkling diamond candles are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Forest path.]

A fallen tree blocks the path, but it is easily circumvented. On the south side lies a small gully and stream flowing east to southwest. It is hard to tell if the path follows the stream or heads back into the trees.  Some glowing enchanted twinkling diamond candles are here.

>[Forest path.]

The forest path follows a muddy gully eroded by a shallow stream. Tall pine and oak trees tower above both sides of the muddy banks. Large mossy stones force the stream to twist and turn as it flows slowly south. The ground seems to be sloping downward slightly as the stream cuts back to the southeast.

>[Forest path.]

The shall stream that serves as the trail's guide is lazy, taking its time. The water murmurs softly to itself as it stumbles over mossy stones and slides beneath large sentinel oaks and pines. The season's leaves decorate the stream's ripples, their greens and browns dappled with shadow and the bit of light allowed to pass through the canopy.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground).
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.
se
>[Forest path.]

A wide, shallow sheet of water forms as two shallow streams join in the gully that accompanies the forest path. A kingfisher watches the shallows with hungered interest; several dragonflies skim the water, while water striders skate along the its surface. The soaring oak, ash, and pine trees do a fair, but not complete, job of blocking the jutting mountain to the south.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground).
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast*.
[Forest path.]

The towering trees of the forest begin their ascension of the large mountain seen from the open plains of New South Lake. The root holds are precarious, as the mountain's face is especially steep on the northern side. The muddy path concludes in front of a sheer stone wall covered with verdant patches of green moss. A numbing breeze blows outward from the depths a massive cavern mouth, as if the mountain itself was exhaling ice-chilled breath. Deep-cut symbols grace the sides of the cavern entrance. They appear to be recently completed, as time, water, and weather have not yet dulled the sharp lines of the cuts.  A massive stone cavern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground).
Obvious paths: northwest*.
go ca
>[Cavern Entrance.]

By swift passage of flood waters, or slow percolating of artesian wells, the towering walls of this sandstone cavern were eroded into eery eliptical shapes, creating an underground network of winding passages. Dozens of misshapen tunnels, chambers, and alcoves start or end in this cavern, their inky black mouths dotting the walls in every direction and height. Apertures in the uneven ground plunge thousands of feet through dripping mists and down into the dark bowels of the earth. Lining the cavern mouth exiting to the forested path are two precisely carved semicircles, one within the other. Their borders are cut several inches deep into the walls and the sandstone has been reinforced with a metallic substance within the double arch. Filling the gaps between the dual arches are deeply gouged draconic runes, glyphs, and wards, each crackling with pent-up azure energy.  A massive stone cavern opening is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground).
Obvious exits: south.
s
s
>[Basin Rim, Dragon Cavern.]

A steep ramp of tightly packed clay, rocks, and detritus descends into a deep basin formed in the sandstone floor of the cavern. The smooth floor of the basin implies natural formation, but deep claw gouges along the sides, although smoothed by the passage of time, bespeak draconic assistance. From the rim of the basin a phantasmal form is visible. Standing perfectly still at the center of the basin it appears statuesque. A sudden flurry of graceful yet precise movement reveals the apparition to be progressing through a series of increasingly complex fighting stances and maneuvers. Each sharp jab, stab, slash, and cut is demonstrated wielding a gleaming scimitar in one hand and a short curved dagger in the other.   A ramp leading down is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground).
Obvious exits: north* east south west.
[Circular Pit, Dragon Cavern.]

A winding tunnel opens above a large depression in the cavern floor. A wide ledge spirals its way down the contour of the circular pit, narrowing as it approaches the flat bed of the bottom. The upper concentric circles of the ledge accommodate several rocks. The large rocks are not made of the abundant sandstone of the caves; rather, they are chiseled obsidian. Most have narrow slits for claw perches, while some are crudely hewn into bowl shapes for seating. Sound reverberates magnificently within the bowl, causing any sound above a whisper to carry to any point in the chamber.   A ledge winding downward, a giant glossy black obsidian rock, a giant glossy black obsidian rock, a slick mottled obsidian bowl-shaped rock, a slick mottled obsidian bowl-shaped rock, and a round carved sandstone tunnel mouth are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground).
Obvious exits: north*.
go tu
>[Cylindrical Tunnel.]

The walls of this sloping tunnel are unlike any other found in the network of caverns. Certain sections of the normally porous sandstone are glossy, almost glass-like. Other parts of the passage appear to have melted and bubbled, leaving behind small craters and fist sized lumps in the rock face. The floor is smooth like red-streaked obsidian, seared by the intense heat that can only be generated by dragon flame.   A round carved sandstone tunnel mouth and a narrow black opening are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground).
Obvious exits: None.
go op
>[Garden, Dragon Cavern.]

The bottleneck widens gradually to reveal a dank underground grotto awash in an otherworldly glow. Drooping tendrilled fungi splotch the striated sandstone cavern ceiling. The thick stalks of the fungi are topped with a head of hundreds of filaments that end with a glowing lavender nodule, giving the entire chamber an eldritch luminescence. A thick carpet of lush burgundy moss blankets the ground and runs up the walls in several instances, thinning into sparse clumps the higher it goes. Where the moss stops its climb, bone-white shelf fungi replaces it; each successive layer jutting further out into the tunnel until reaching the ceiling. Growing in no discernable manner on top of the moss are billowy balloon mushrooms, each easily four feet in radius. Their diaphanous membranes show millions of spores waiting to be exhaled out a small mouth if disturbed. Rounding out the fungal flora are several groups of seven foot tall toadstools, each displaying a dazzling array of shifting fluorescence on their caps.   A large oval sandstone hole in the wall is here.

This room is illuminated.

[Garden, Dragon Cavern.]

The bottleneck widens gradually to reveal a dank underground grotto awash in an otherworldly glow. Drooping tendrilled fungi splotch the striated sandstone cavern ceiling. The thick stalks of the fungi are topped with a head of hundreds of filaments that end with a glowing lavender nodule, giving the entire chamber an eldritch luminescence. A thick carpet of lush burgundy moss blankets the ground and runs up the walls in several instances, thinning into sparse clumps the higher it goes. Where the moss stops its climb, bone-white shelf fungi replaces it; each successive layer jutting further out into the tunnel until reaching the ceiling. Growing in no discernable manner on top of the moss are billowy balloon mushrooms, each easily four feet in radius. Their diaphanous membranes show millions of spores waiting to be exhaled out a small mouth if disturbed. Rounding out the fungal flora are several groups of seven foot tall toadstools, each displaying a dazzling array of shifting fluorescence on their caps.   A large oval sandstone hole in the wall is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Beauty the Secian, Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Kinverati the Draco, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above ground), Weldoian the Noble Secian (seated and holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake (seated), Kavita the Noble Secian, Magenta the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (seated), Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: southeast.

The area brightens.
[Cylindrical Tunnel.]

The walls of this sloping tunnel are unlike any other found in the network of caverns. Certain sections of the normally porous sandstone are glossy, almost glass-like. Other parts of the passage appear to have melted and bubbled, leaving behind small craters and fist sized lumps in the rock face. The floor is smooth like red-streaked obsidian, seared by the intense heat that can only be generated by dragon flame.   A round carved sandstone tunnel mouth and a narrow black opening are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Kinverati the Draco, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above ground), Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Linus the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

The area brightens.
[Circular Pit, Dragon Cavern.]

A winding tunnel opens above a large depression in the cavern floor. A wide ledge spirals its way down the contour of the circular pit, narrowing as it approaches the flat bed of the bottom. The upper concentric circles of the ledge accommodate several rocks. The large rocks are not made of the abundant sandstone of the caves; rather, they are chiseled obsidian. Most have narrow slits for claw perches, while some are crudely hewn into bowl shapes for seating. Sound reverberates magnificently within the bowl, causing any sound above a whisper to carry to any point in the chamber.   A ledge winding downward, a giant glossy black obsidian rock, a giant glossy black obsidian rock, a slick mottled obsidian bowl-shaped rock, a slick mottled obsidian bowl-shaped rock, and a round carved sandstone tunnel mouth are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Kinverati the Draco, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above ground), Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Linus the Draco.

l
The area brightens.
[Basin Rim, Dragon Cavern.]

A steep ramp of tightly packed clay, rocks, and detritus descends into a deep basin formed in the sandstone floor of the cavern. The smooth floor of the basin implies natural formation, but deep claw gouges along the sides, although smoothed by the passage of time, bespeak draconic assistance. From the rim of the basin a phantasmal form is visible. Standing perfectly still at the center of the basin it appears statuesque. A sudden flurry of graceful yet precise movement reveals the apparition to be progressing through a series of increasingly complex fighting stances and maneuvers. Each sharp jab, stab, slash, and cut is demonstrated wielding a gleaming scimitar in one hand and a short curved dagger in the other.   A ramp leading down is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Kinverati the Draco, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above ground), Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Linus the Draco.
Obvious exits: north east south* west.

l
The area brightens.
[Cavern Entrance.]

By swift passage of flood waters, or slow percolating of artesian wells, the towering walls of this sandstone cavern were eroded into eery eliptical shapes, creating an underground network of winding passages. Dozens of misshapen tunnels, chambers, and alcoves start or end in this cavern, their inky black mouths dotting the walls in every direction and height. Apertures in the uneven ground plunge thousands of feet through dripping mists and down into the dark bowels of the earth. Lining the cavern mouth exiting to the forested path are two precisely carved semicircles, one within the other. Their borders are cut several inches deep into the walls and the sandstone has been reinforced with a metallic substance within the double arch. Filling the gaps between the dual arches are deeply gouged draconic runes, glyphs, and wards, each crackling with pent-up azure energy.  A massive stone cavern opening is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Kinverati the Draco, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above ground), Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Linus the Draco.
Obvious exits: south*.

[Forest path.]

The towering trees of the forest begin their ascension of the large mountain seen from the open plains of New South Lake. The root holds are precarious, as the mountain's face is especially steep on the northern side. The muddy path concludes in front of a sheer stone wall covered with verdant patches of green moss. A numbing breeze blows outward from the depths a massive cavern mouth, as if the mountain itself was exhaling ice-chilled breath. Deep-cut symbols grace the sides of the cavern entrance. They appear to be recently completed, as time, water, and weather have not yet dulled the sharp lines of the cuts.  A massive stone cavern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st bat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Kinverati the Draco, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above ground), Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Linus the Draco.
Obvious paths: northwest*.

You follow Bodhi northwest...

[Forest path.]

A wide, shallow sheet of water forms as two shallow streams join in the gully that accompanies the forest path. A kingfisher watches the shallows with hungered interest; several dragonflies skim the water, while water striders skate along the its surface. The soaring oak, ash, and pine trees do a fair, but not complete, job of blocking the jutting mountain to the south.

[Bridge]

With Meetpoint at your heels this rugged old cobblestone bridge leads to the Southern Plains and the main trade routes from spur and Meetpoint to the Southernmost reaches of the lands. Signs that this road was once well traveled by the hustle and bustle of laden carts are plain to view. [Meetpoint.]

Here a gate leads out of the fort and into the Southern regions. Several children run and play just inside the gate, under the watchful eyes of the guards. What was once a very well used trade route has slowed to some caravans bringing supplies for the townsmen and the occasional merchants traveling from the far southern reaches of the land. Many guards protect this section of the fort as it is home to some wild beasts that live outside these walls. In the distance, you can make out two more guards hunting the frogmen that often try to attack the city and caravans.  An open large sturdy wooden gate and a glowing wrought iron lantern are here.

[Wilderness gate.]

Set within a wide tunnel leading through the hedge to the north is the Wilderness Gate. It separates the settled lands of Spur from the open plains to the south of the city. The plains stretch as far as the eyes can see, the horizon and the walls of the fort down the road the only blemishes of the grassy landscape in the distance. The stones of the road are smoothly set together, well built to withstand heavy travel. A broken wagon wheel, discarded some time ago, covers a spot of nearby grass, weeds trying to climb through the spokes.  An open bronze gate is here.

[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  An open iron gate and a rainbow silk tent are here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Bodhi north...

[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  An open iron gate and a rainbow silk tent are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Linus the Draco.

Suddenly, Beauty throws the burning sphere in her hand at the pair of flame hounds! It hits and explodes violently, burning it!
    The pair of flame hounds is knocked back!

The pair of flame hounds turn their heads up to the sky and howl. Their heads begin to dissipate into steam, soon followed by the rest of the bodies.

The explosion which just rocked the pair of flame hounds calms and ends.

Minute coils of violet draconic runemagick circle the end of Mirrdae's claws and slowly spiral up his forearms.

A shield of celestial light suddenly encircles Linus's body!

Faliarin removes his ivory studded leather buckler.

Draffut snickers at Nokin.

Faliarin readies a two-handed lapis hilted steel falchion.
You see Grysmor move up another 5 UDs!

You follow Bodhi southeast...

The area brightens.
[Kelmar's passage.]

Carpets of black moss lead up to an impressive door made out of a chunk of an extremely beautiful metal. The door is far too sturdy to break down; you must have the key to reach the fabled wealth within.  An open giant tan morbius door is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st pair of flame hounds, the 2nd pair of flame hounds, the 3rd pair of flame hounds, and the 4th pair of flame hounds.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying beside you), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: northwest*.

Mystical energy begins to crackle down the length of Helios's arms.

[Kelmar's cache.]

This narrow ledge looks down a deep, wide chasm that has an odd, reddish light to it. On the other side of the chasm is a landing, fully laden with chests and glinting precious metals.  An open giant tan morbius door is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st pair of flame hounds, the 2nd pair of flame hounds, the 3rd pair of flame hounds, the 4th pair of flame hounds, and the 1st fire elemental.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (flying beside you), Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

[Kelmar's cache.]

The landing continues to this point. The walls have been partly carved as if someone had once tried to make a larger vault here. You wonder what this was all for.  A large alcove is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st pair of flame hounds, the 2nd pair of flame hounds, the 3rd pair of flame hounds, the 4th pair of flame hounds, the 1st fire elemental, the 2nd fire elemental, the 3rd fire elemental, the 4th fire elemental, the 5th fire elemental, and the 5th pair of flame hounds.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: north.

Minute coils of violet draconic runemagick circle the end of Draffut's claws and slowly spiral up his forearms.
But the runes quickly fly apart after being called!

The warm white glow spreads out and wraps lovingly around Clara!

The white glow about Clara dims and fades away.

The white mist swirls about Clara and gently seeps into her skin!

Clara's skin takes on an ethereal glow which quickly fades away.

[Melted Alcove.]

The walls of this hidden chamber are full of jagged protrusions and deep holes. Numerous scorch marks mar the stone in an undecipherable pattern. Whatever formed this alcove, it was unnatural. Rock spires jut down from the ceiling, as if the roof of the space was liquified and slowly cooled. The cave is frigid, save for an arch outlined by fist-sized fire opals on the west most wall. Fiery spouts periodically spew forth from the center of the opals.  A fire opal lined arch and a large landing are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st white hot magma sentinel, the 2nd white hot magma sentinel, the 1st pair of flame hounds, the 2nd pair of flame hounds, the 3rd pair of flame hounds, and the 4th pair of flame hounds.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Melted Alcove.]

The walls of this hidden chamber are full of jagged protrusions and deep holes. Numerous scorch marks mar the stone in an undecipherable pattern. Whatever formed this alcove, it was unnatural. Rock spires jut down from the ceiling, as if the roof of the space was liquified and slowly cooled. The cave is frigid, save for an arch outlined by fist-sized fire opals on the west most wall. Fiery spouts periodically spew forth from the center of the opals.  A fire opal lined arch and a large landing are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens.   A tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry, a large black obsidian table, a steaming red glass jar, a sealed clear glass jar, and some dark grey granite stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st white hot magma sentinel, the 2nd white hot magma sentinel, the 1st pair of flame hounds, the 2nd pair of flame hounds, the 3rd pair of flame hounds, and the 3rd white hot magma sentinel.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens.   A tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry, a large black obsidian table, a steaming red glass jar, a sealed clear glass jar, and some dark grey granite stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens.   A tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry, a large black obsidian table, a steaming red glass jar, a sealed clear glass jar, and some dark grey granite stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.
>

Julia briefly touches Viator.

The tendrils of green energy surround Ying's body, causing her muscles to bulge and increase in size!  

You follow Bodhi through some dark grey granite stairs...

[Private Quarters.]

A narrow bed shoved against one wall is the only indication that this room might be anything other than a library dedicated to the study of magick and the races of dragon and wyvern. A tall set of shelves along one wall holds specimens and scrolls, and the large desk beneath the single window is covered with parchments and maps. Amidst the papers on the desk lie a few dark ovoid shapes, one that glistens wetly and could be the source of a low background humming noise. The back wall is lined with a row of hooks, from which hangs a the body of a young wyvern, possibly dead.  The head is marked with still glowing runes that have been burnt or carved into the scales.   Some dark grey granite stairs and a rune-inscribed gleaming obsidian archway are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st pair of flame hounds, the 2nd pair of flame hounds, the 3rd pair of flame hounds, and the 1st white hot magma sentinel.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

You follow Bodhi through a rune-inscribed gleaming obsidian archway...

[Small Laboratory.]

A single long stone table fills the center of the room, covered in vials, beakers and an assortment of unusual equipment. The smell in the room is a mix of sulfur, blood and a burning acidic reek. Small orbs of magefire hang in midair above the table, pulsing with an eldritch light. A locked crystalla fronted cupboard stands against one wall, filled with carefully labeled jars. Atop the cupboard is a small cage filled with glowing red-eyed rodents.   A tiny petrified wyvernbone skeleton, a small dark wooden rack of vials, a putrid yellow glass vial, a steaming chartreuse glass vial, a blood filled glass vial, an open short long shadowglass chest, an open hand carved duskwood trunk, a rune-inscribed gleaming obsidian archway, and a closed large blackened duskwood trapdoor are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st white hot magma sentinel and the 2nd white hot magma sentinel.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

For anyone larger than a Hithual, this winding staircase would be a very tight fit. Tiny rodents with glowing red eyes scamper up and down the inner wall of the passage. The air is damp, but relatively fresh, carrying a heavy earthen smell on its currents.   Some winding steps leading downward and an open large blackened duskwood trapdoor are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st pair of flame hounds, the 2nd pair of flame hounds, the 3rd pair of flame hounds, and the 4th pair of flame hounds.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (flying 10 feet below you and holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Ricochet the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Julia the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet below you), Rydareon the Drake (flying 5 feet below you), Weldoian the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying 10 feet below you), Mirrdae the Drake (flying 10 feet below you), Clara the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Mikasi the Drake (flying 10 feet below you), Kavita the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet below you), Twilight the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet below you), Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake (flying 10 feet below you), Raptorian the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet below you), Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

info

You are Glinka Dragondsfriend, a delicate boned and wiry-tough bodied 41 year old Orderly Female adolescent Secian Cleric of the Order of the Heart.  You are 1'2" and weigh 12 lbs.  You are currently 15 feet above the ground.  You are ravenous.  You are sloshing.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

The air is cool along the spiral staircase, made more so by the chilling winds blowing up from the bottom of the passage. Slightly glowing lichen lines your path, save for a well-worn channel in the dead center of the steps.  Some winding steps leading downward and some winding steps leading upward are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st pair of flame hounds and the 2nd pair of flame hounds.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A strong wind blows from the bottom of the winding stairs. Billowing capes and cloaks for any wearing such articles, the gusting air makes it difficult to hear anything other than its own mournful howling. [Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A strong wind blows from the bottom of the winding stairs. Billowing capes and cloaks for any wearing such articles, the gusting air makes it difficult to hear anything other than its own mournful howling. Water drips from the ceiling high above, joining the luminiferous lichen clinging to the steps to make a perilous pathway.  Some winding steps leading downward and some winding steps leading upward are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st white hot magma sentinel, the 1st pair of flame hounds, and the 2nd pair of flame hounds.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (flying 20 feet above you and holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian (lying down), Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you and holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Clara the Secian (lying down), Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Verbaniah the Secian (flying 30 feet above you), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Kavita the Noble Secian (lying down), Grysmor the Noble Secian (flying 25 feet above you), Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Ying the Drake (lying down), Bodhi the Drake (lying down), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A strong wind blows from the bottom of the winding stairs. Billowing capes and cloaks for any wearing such articles, the gusting air makes it difficult to hear anything other than its own mournful howling. Water drips from the ceiling high above, joining the luminiferous lichen clinging to the steps to make a perilous pathway.  Some winding steps leading downward and some winding steps leading upward are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st white hot magma sentinel, the 1st pair of flame hounds, and the 2nd pair of flame hounds.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (lying down), Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (lying down), Julia the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you and holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake (lying down), Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (flying beside you), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake (flying 10 feet below you), Kavita the Noble Secian (flying 25 feet below you), Grysmor the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Silran the Secian (lying down and holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian (lying down), Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake (lying down), Bodhi the Drake (lying down), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco (lying down), Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A strong wind blows from the bottom of the winding stairs. Billowing capes and cloaks for any wearing such articles, the gusting air makes it difficult to hear anything other than its own mournful howling. Water drips from the ceiling high above, joining the luminiferous lichen clinging to the steps to make a perilous pathway.  Some winding steps leading downward, some winding steps leading upward, and an arch of ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (seated and holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco (seated), Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (seated), Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian (seated), Kiki the Secian (lying down), Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian (lying down), Julia the Noble Secian (flying 20 feet above ground), Rydareon the Drake (seated), Weldoian the Noble Secian (seated and holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (seated), Mirrdae the Drake (seated), Clara the Secian (lying down), Viator the Draco (lying down), Nokin the Drake (seated), Verbaniah the Secian (seated), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian (seated), Grysmor the Noble Secian (flying 35 feet above ground), Silran the Secian (lying down and holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian (seated), Twilight the Noble Secian (seated), Ying the Drake (seated), Bodhi the Drake (seated), Raptorian the Noble Secian (seated), Feletia the Draco (seated), Linus the Draco (lying down), and Helios the Draco.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A grate covers the spanse of floor leading from a heavily reinforced door to a steep, winding spiral staircase. Due to the damp conditions and dripping water, the bluesteel grate underfoot has long since lost its luster. A harsh wind blows upward through the grate, swirls around in the landing, and streams up the staircase. An eerie cacophony of moans and howls accompany the wind.  Some winding steps leading upward and a closed bluesteel reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A grate covers the spanse of floor leading from a heavily reinforced door to a steep, winding spiral staircase. Due to the damp conditions and dripping water, the bluesteel grate underfoot has long since lost its luster. A harsh wind blows upward through the grate, swirls around in the landing, and streams up the staircase. An eerie cacophony of moans and howls accompany the wind.  Some winding steps leading upward and an open bluesteel reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st pair of flame hounds.
In the room is Everest the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Staging Area.]

This long and narrow passage appears to have been carved straight through the rock foundation of Tazanda'ar Keep. The passage is relatively short near the duskwood door, but the ground underfoot slopes sharply until the height of the passage guarded by the portcullis is lost in the darkness high above. A regularly place intervals along the passage, a short wall has been constructed, offering defensible positions. From what is the question?  A shining Saldean silver spear rack, a shining Saldean silver spear rack, an open bluesteel reinforced duskwood door, and a giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis are here.

The area brightens.
[Underground Courtyard.]

An uneasy silence fills this crescent shaped courtyard. Surrounding you are walls of smooth, dull grey stone carved out of the very foundation rock of the Keep somewhere far above you. Although empty and seemingly uninhabited, the courtyard shows signs of maintenance; the hewn stone floors and walls meticulously dust, dirt and cobweb free. Dozens of smokeless oil lamps suspended from wrought iron poles embedded deep into the stone of the floor cast overlapping spheres of light that illuminate the entire courtyard brightly. Any sound made echoes faintly off the impossibly tall walls that create the inner curve of the crescent. The top of the inner wall is not visible, the grey of their stone fading into the grey of the indistinguishable ceiling. To the west, a tower-top is visible in the dim light of the upper regions of this peculiar fortress. At the western corner of the crescent is a doorway sealed with a thick, bloodsteel hinged steelwood door.   A giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis and a closed bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Staging Area.]

This long and narrow passage appears to have been carved straight through the rock foundation of Tazanda'ar Keep. The passage is relatively short near the duskwood door, but the ground underfoot slopes sharply until the height of the passage guarded by the portcullis is lost in the darkness high above. A regularly place intervals along the passage, a short wall has been constructed, offering defensible positions. From what is the question? The area brightens.
[Underground Courtyard.]

An uneasy silence fills this crescent shaped courtyard. Surrounding you are walls of smooth, dull grey stone carved out of the very foundation rock of the Keep somewhere far above you. Although empty and seemingly uninhabited, the courtyard shows signs of maintenance; the hewn stone floors and walls meticulously dust, dirt and cobweb free. Dozens of smokeless oil lamps suspended from wrought iron poles embedded deep into the stone of the floor cast overlapping spheres of light that illuminate the entire courtyard brightly. Any sound made echoes faintly off the impossibly tall walls that create the inner curve of the crescent. The top of the inner wall is not visible, the grey of their stone fading into the grey of the indistinguishable ceiling. To the west, a tower-top is visible in the dim light of the upper regions of this peculiar fortress. At the western corner of the crescent is a doorway sealed with a thick, bloodsteel hinged steelwood door.   A giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

The area brightens.
[Steep Stairway.]

A feat of masonry genius, a staircase of giant, grey stone blocks spirals around and around the walls of the tower from the small entryway at the bottom of the tower all the way to  a narrow platform at the top of the tower where an archway leads into a room. Looking up or down from any point through the center of the staircase gives you a clear view of the dizzying drop awaiting someone careless enough to get too close to the unguarded outer edge of the stairs.  A steep stairway leading up and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

The area brightens.
[Observation Room.]

Empty except for a few sparse furnishings, the tower room's focus is a wide window that looks down into three wedge-shaped cells that form the inner circle of the fortress. Although possible to see all three cells, the contents of one cell in particular is fully viewable whereas the other two cells are only partially visible. From so high above, the walls do not look as impossibly tall as they appeared from the ground. More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window.  One on each side of the room, two staircases lead to different parts of the lower level, one spiraling back down to the entrance courtyard and the other into the main portion of the fortress.  A steep staircase, a steep staircase, and an open heavy reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: west*.

The area brightens.
[Specimen Room.]

A large black marble table dominates most of the floor space of this busy room. The air is bone numbing in its chilliness. Wrought iron shelves, bolted to the walls with orichalcum pins, line the perimeter of the room. The walls themselves are hidden from you due to the shelves being so overstocked. The western wall houses sealed jars, beakers, stoppered vials, bottles, and topped flasks. The eastern walls shelves are lined with specimens of birds, lizards, snakes, and creatures somewhere in between. Most of the creatures are preserved in fluid or dried, though a good many of the smaller ones are alive and housed in cages or giant mesh-lidded glass jars. Shrieks issue from one particular cage drawing your attention to a enraged, winged creature with both reptilian and avian characteristics.  An open heavy reinforced duskwood door is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: south.

Clara inhales.

The area brightens.
[Specimen Room.]

The southern wall boasts perfectly shrunken skeletons of many different species. Many of the skeletons are from easily recognizable animals. Most of the articulated figures reflect a collector with draconic interests. There are skeletons each of the four stages of dragons, a drag-al skeleton, a wyvern skeleton, and some type of winged serpent creature. Each has been seemingly scaled down to three to four foot size. The wall to the north is lined with similar, shrunken specimens in various stages of dissection. The torso of a drag-al lays spread open, ribs broken and pulled back so the internal organs can be viewed. A long arm with structure resembling an older dragon lays here with the skin flayed off the lower arm, revealing the musculature above the radius and ulna. The fingers have been stripped entirely of their skin, muscle, and flesh, detailing the bone structure of the fingers and claws.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: north*.

The area brightens.
[Observation Room.]

Empty except for a few sparse furnishings, the tower room's focus is a wide window that looks down into three wedge-shaped cells that form the inner circle of the fortress. Although possible to see all three cells, the contents of one cell in particular is fully viewable whereas the other two cells are only partially visible. From so high above, the walls do not look as impossibly tall as they appeared from the ground. More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window.  One on each side of the room, two staircases lead to different parts of the lower level, one spiraling back down to the entrance courtyard and the other into the main portion of the fortress.  A steep staircase, a steep staircase, and an open heavy reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

The area brightens.
[Crescent-Shaped Hall.]

A long hallway curves around gradually to the east. The outer walls are cool to the touch and are part of the living rock that has been carved away to make this underground keep. The inner walls, although carved of the same rock, are freestanding in spite of the fact that their vertical culmination is lost in the gloom of the upper atmosphere of this giant, man-made cavern. Set several paces apart into the inner wall are three huge bloodsteel gated archways. Iron sconces embedded in the outer walls dangle small, smokeless oil lamps that illuminate the hall brightly.  A steep staircase, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, and a huge bloodsteel gated archway are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

The area brightens.
[Observation Room.]

Empty except for a few sparse furnishings, the tower room's focus is a wide window that looks down into three wedge-shaped cells that form the inner circle of the fortress. Although possible to see all three cells, the contents of one cell in particular is fully viewable whereas the other two cells are only partially visible. From so high above, the walls do not look as impossibly tall as they appeared from the ground. More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window.  One on each side of the room, two staircases lead to different parts of the lower level, one spiraling back down to the entrance courtyard and the other into the main portion of the fortress.  A steep staircase, a steep staircase, and an open heavy reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: west*.
