[Corner of Observation Room.]

A device cracks with green energy upon the far wall. Seemingly a rectangular metal box, the upper surface has nine square holes cut into it. Exactly nine cubic pieces are arranged in a straight line along the upper edge of the box. Each cube as a number on it, ranging from one to nine. A diagram is sketched on a piece of parchment next to the device.   A detailed parchment diagram is here.

This room is illuminated.

More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window.  One on each side of the room, two staircases lead to different parts of the lower level, one spiraling back down to the entrance courtyard and the other into the main portion of the fortress. [Observation Room.]

Empty except for a few sparse furnishings, the tower room's focus is a wide window that looks down into three wedge-shaped cells that form the inner circle of the fortress. Although possible to see all three cells, the contents of one cell in particular is fully viewable whereas the other two cells are only partially visible. From so high above, the walls do not look as impossibly tall as they appeared from the ground. More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window. [Crescent-Shaped Hall.]

A long hallway curves around gradually to the east. The outer walls are cool to the touch and are part of the living rock that has been carved away to make this underground keep. The inner walls, although carved of the same rock, are freestanding in spite of the fact that their vertical culmination is lost in the gloom of the upper atmosphere of this giant, man-made cavern. Set several paces apart into the inner wall are three huge bloodsteel gated archways. Iron sconces embedded in the outer walls dangle small, smokeless oil lamps that illuminate the hall brightly.  A steep staircase, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, and a huge bloodsteel gated archway are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Cell.]

While the other areas of this underground area have been neatly kept, this pen is a mess. Dirty straw stands three feet deep throughout the wedge-shaped confinement. The red-brown stain of dried blood pairs with its metallic tangy scent to demonstrate the pen has been used for ill will. The grey stone walls are scorched black along much of the perimeter. Two long starsteel rods run the span of the pen about fifeteen feet off the ground. Cracked and yellowing bones are mixed within the straw bedding.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway is here.

[Cell.]

While the other areas of this underground area have been neatly kept, this pen is a mess. Dirty straw stands three feet deep throughout the wedge-shaped confinement. The red-brown stain of dried blood pairs with its metallic tangy scent to demonstrate the pen has been used for ill will. The grey stone walls are scorched black along much of the perimeter. Two long starsteel rods run the span of the pen about fifeteen feet off the ground. Cracked and yellowing bones are mixed within the straw bedding.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway, a pale green glass bottle, and an open intricately woven reed bread basket are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Draffut the Drake, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake (seated), Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Molly the Secian (lying down), Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon (lying down), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian (holding a glowing finely woven silver mesh cage of fireflies), Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Bodhi the Drake, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cell.]

While the other areas of this underground area have been neatly kept, this pen is a mess. Dirty straw stands three feet deep throughout the wedge-shaped confinement. The red-brown stain of dried blood pairs with its metallic tangy scent to demonstrate the pen has been used for ill will. The grey stone walls are scorched black along much of the perimeter. Two long starsteel rods run the span of the pen about fifeteen feet off the ground. Cracked and yellowing bones are mixed within the straw bedding.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway, a pale green glass bottle, an open intricately woven reed bread basket, and a raw landshark filet are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Crescent-Shaped Hall.]

A long hallway curves around gradually to the east. The outer walls are cool to the touch and are part of the living rock that has been carved away to make this underground keep. The inner walls, although carved of the same rock, are freestanding in spite of the fact that their vertical culmination is lost in the gloom of the upper atmosphere of this giant, man-made cavern. Set several paces apart into the inner wall are three huge bloodsteel gated archways. Iron sconces embedded in the outer walls dangle small, smokeless oil lamps that illuminate the hall brightly.  A steep staircase, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, and a huge bloodsteel gated archway are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go st
>[Observation Room.]

Empty except for a few sparse furnishings, the tower room's focus is a wide window that looks down into three wedge-shaped cells that form the inner circle of the fortress. Although possible to see all three cells, the contents of one cell in particular is fully viewable whereas the other two cells are only partially visible. From so high above, the walls do not look as impossibly tall as they appeared from the ground. More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window.  One on each side of the room, two staircases lead to different parts of the lower level, one spiraling back down to the entrance courtyard and the other into the main portion of the fortress.  A steep staircase, a steep staircase, and an open heavy reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.
go st
>[Steep Stairway.]

A feat of masonry genius, a staircase of giant, grey stone blocks spirals around and around the walls of the tower from the small entryway at the bottom of the tower all the way to  a narrow platform at the top of the tower where an archway leads into a room. Looking up or down from any point through the center of the staircase gives you a clear view of the dizzying drop awaiting someone careless enough to get too close to the unguarded outer edge of the stairs.  A steep stairway leading up and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

go door
>[Specimen Room.]

A large black marble table dominates most of the floor space of this busy room. The air is bone numbing in its chilliness. Wrought iron shelves, bolted to the walls with orichalcum pins, line the perimeter of the room. The walls themselves are hidden from you due to the shelves being so overstocked. The western wall houses sealed jars, beakers, stoppered vials, bottles, and topped flasks. The eastern walls shelves are lined with specimens of birds, lizards, snakes, and creatures somewhere in between. Most of the creatures are preserved in fluid or dried, though a good many of the smaller ones are alive and housed in cages or giant mesh-lidded glass jars. Shrieks issue from one particular cage drawing your attention to a enraged, winged creature with both reptilian and avian characteristics.  An open heavy reinforced duskwood door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south.

>[Underground Courtyard.]

An uneasy silence fills this crescent shaped courtyard. Surrounding you are walls of smooth, dull grey stone carved out of the very foundation rock of the Keep somewhere far above you. Although empty and seemingly uninhabited, the courtyard shows signs of maintenance; the hewn stone floors and walls meticulously dust, dirt and cobweb free. Dozens of smokeless oil lamps suspended from wrought iron poles embedded deep into the stone of the floor cast overlapping spheres of light that illuminate the entire courtyard brightly. Any sound made echoes faintly off the impossibly tall walls that create the inner curve of the crescent. The top of the inner wall is not visible, the grey of their stone fading into the grey of the indistinguishable ceiling. To the west, a tower-top is visible in the dim light of the upper regions of this peculiar fortress. At the western corner of the crescent is a doorway sealed with a thick, bloodsteel hinged steelwood door.   A giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Corner of Observation Room.]

A device cracks with green energy upon the far wall. Seemingly a rectangular metal box, the upper surface has nine square holes cut into it. Exactly nine cubic pieces are arranged in a straight line along the upper edge of the box. Each cube as a number on it, ranging from one to nine. A diagram is sketched on a piece of parchment next to the device.   A detailed parchment diagram is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Kalessin the Noble Drake, Julia the Noble Secian, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Verbaniah the Secian, Bodhi the Drake, and Raptorian the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: east*.

[Corner of Observation Room.]

A device cracks with green energy upon the far wall. Seemingly a rectangular metal box, the upper surface has nine square holes cut into it. Exactly nine cubic pieces are arranged in a straight line along the upper edge of the box. Each cube as a number on it, ranging from one to nine. A diagram is sketched on a piece of parchment next to the device.   A detailed parchment diagram is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), and Verbaniah the Secian.
Obvious exits: east.

[Observation Room.]

Empty except for a few sparse furnishings, the tower room's focus is a wide window that looks down into three wedge-shaped cells that form the inner circle of the fortress. Although possible to see all three cells, the contents of one cell in particular is fully viewable whereas the other two cells are only partially visible. From so high above, the walls do not look as impossibly tall as they appeared from the ground. More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window.  One on each side of the room, two staircases lead to different parts of the lower level, one spiraling back down to the entrance courtyard and the other into the main portion of the fortress.  A steep staircase, a steep staircase, and an open heavy reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.
>
Weldoian just entered through a steep staircase.

Weldoian just went through a steep staircase.
[Crescent-Shaped Hall.]

A long hallway curves around gradually to the east. The outer walls are cool to the touch and are part of the living rock that has been carved away to make this underground keep. The inner walls, although carved of the same rock, are freestanding in spite of the fact that their vertical culmination is lost in the gloom of the upper atmosphere of this giant, man-made cavern. Set several paces apart into the inner wall are three huge bloodsteel gated archways. Iron sconces embedded in the outer walls dangle small, smokeless oil lamps that illuminate the hall brightly.  A steep staircase, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, and a huge bloodsteel gated archway are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern).
Obvious exits: None.

[Cell.]

A stale scent hangs in the air within this cell. Stains, blood and some indistinguishable, on the floor and the musty pile of straw littered with small animal bones in the back corner leave the source of the scent to your imagination. Heavy bloodsteel leg and arm restraints are embedded into one of the walls. Dusty but still in good repair, the manacles dangle from their chains awaiting use. Shallow claw marks score the walls around the arm restrains and on the floor directly below.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cell.]

While the other areas of this underground area have been neatly kept, this pen is a mess. Dirty straw stands three feet deep throughout the wedge-shaped confinement. The red-brown stain of dried blood pairs with its metallic tangy scent to demonstrate the pen has been used for ill will. The grey stone walls are scorched black along much of the perimeter. Two long starsteel rods run the span of the pen about fifeteen feet off the ground. Cracked and yellowing bones are mixed within the straw bedding.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway, a pale green glass bottle, an open intricately woven reed bread basket, and a raw landshark filet are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Molly the Secian's lifeless body, Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon (lying down), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cell.]

While the other areas of this underground area have been neatly kept, this pen is a mess. Dirty straw stands three feet deep throughout the wedge-shaped confinement. The red-brown stain of dried blood pairs with its metallic tangy scent to demonstrate the pen has been used for ill will. The grey stone walls are scorched black along much of the perimeter. Two long starsteel rods run the span of the pen about fifeteen feet off the ground. Cracked and yellowing bones are mixed within the straw bedding.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway, a pale green glass bottle, an open intricately woven reed bread basket, and a raw landshark filet are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Molly the Secian's lifeless body, Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon (lying down), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cell.]

While the other areas of this underground area have been neatly kept, this pen is a mess. Dirty straw stands three feet deep throughout the wedge-shaped confinement. The red-brown stain of dried blood pairs with its metallic tangy scent to demonstrate the pen has been used for ill will. The grey stone walls are scorched black along much of the perimeter. Two long starsteel rods run the span of the pen about fifeteen feet off the ground. Cracked and yellowing bones are mixed within the straw bedding.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway, a pale green glass bottle, and an open intricately woven reed bread basket are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (seated and holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Molly the Secian's lifeless body, Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon (lying down), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cell.]

While the other areas of this underground area have been neatly kept, this pen is a mess. Dirty straw stands three feet deep throughout the wedge-shaped confinement. The red-brown stain of dried blood pairs with its metallic tangy scent to demonstrate the pen has been used for ill will. The grey stone walls are scorched black along much of the perimeter. Two long starsteel rods run the span of the pen about fifeteen feet off the ground. Cracked and yellowing bones are mixed within the straw bedding.  A huge bloodsteel gated archway, a pale green glass bottle, and an open intricately woven reed bread basket are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco (seated), Everest the Noble Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon's lifeless body, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (seated), Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Crescent-Shaped Hall.]

A long hallway curves around gradually to the east. The outer walls are cool to the touch and are part of the living rock that has been carved away to make this underground keep. The inner walls, although carved of the same rock, are freestanding in spite of the fact that their vertical culmination is lost in the gloom of the upper atmosphere of this giant, man-made cavern. Set several paces apart into the inner wall are three huge bloodsteel gated archways. Iron sconces embedded in the outer walls dangle small, smokeless oil lamps that illuminate the hall brightly.  A steep staircase, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, a huge bloodsteel gated archway, and a huge bloodsteel gated archway are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Viator the Draco, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon's lifeless body, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

[Observation Room.]

Empty except for a few sparse furnishings, the tower room's focus is a wide window that looks down into three wedge-shaped cells that form the inner circle of the fortress. Although possible to see all three cells, the contents of one cell in particular is fully viewable whereas the other two cells are only partially visible. From so high above, the walls do not look as impossibly tall as they appeared from the ground. More oil lamps illuminate the ceilingless room, explaining the ability to see its upper crenellations from the courtyard. Two chairs and a writing podium stand near the center of the window.  One on each side of the room, two staircases lead to different parts of the lower level, one spiraling back down to the entrance courtyard and the other into the main portion of the fortress.  A steep staircase, a steep staircase, and an open heavy reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Mieglyn the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Grysmor the Noble Secian, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: west*.

[Steep Stairway.]

A feat of masonry genius, a staircase of giant, grey stone blocks spirals around and around the walls of the tower from the small entryway at the bottom of the tower all the way to  a narrow platform at the top of the tower where an archway leads into a room. Looking up or down from any point through the center of the staircase gives you a clear view of the dizzying drop awaiting someone careless enough to get too close to the unguarded outer edge of the stairs.  A steep stairway leading up and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

The area brightens.
[Underground Courtyard.]

An uneasy silence fills this crescent shaped courtyard. Surrounding you are walls of smooth, dull grey stone carved out of the very foundation rock of the Keep somewhere far above you. Although empty and seemingly uninhabited, the courtyard shows signs of maintenance; the hewn stone floors and walls meticulously dust, dirt and cobweb free. Dozens of smokeless oil lamps suspended from wrought iron poles embedded deep into the stone of the floor cast overlapping spheres of light that illuminate the entire courtyard brightly. Any sound made echoes faintly off the impossibly tall walls that create the inner curve of the crescent. The top of the inner wall is not visible, the grey of their stone fading into the grey of the indistinguishable ceiling. To the west, a tower-top is visible in the dim light of the upper regions of this peculiar fortress. At the western corner of the crescent is a doorway sealed with a thick, bloodsteel hinged steelwood door.   A giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st spaglen tier, the 2nd spaglen tier, and the 3rd spaglen tier.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon's lifeless body, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

Helios whispers a chant as flecks of blue light begin to swirl about him.

[Underground Courtyard.]

An uneasy silence fills this crescent shaped courtyard. Surrounding you are walls of smooth, dull grey stone carved out of the very foundation rock of the Keep somewhere far above you. Although empty and seemingly uninhabited, the courtyard shows signs of maintenance; the hewn stone floors and walls meticulously dust, dirt and cobweb free. Dozens of smokeless oil lamps suspended from wrought iron poles embedded deep into the stone of the floor cast overlapping spheres of light that illuminate the entire courtyard brightly. Any sound made echoes faintly off the impossibly tall walls that create the inner curve of the crescent. The top of the inner wall is not visible, the grey of their stone fading into the grey of the indistinguishable ceiling. To the west, a tower-top is visible in the dim light of the upper regions of this peculiar fortress. At the western corner of the crescent is a doorway sealed with a thick, bloodsteel hinged steelwood door.   A giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st spaglen tier.

l
[Underground Courtyard.]

An uneasy silence fills this crescent shaped courtyard. Surrounding you are walls of smooth, dull grey stone carved out of the very foundation rock of the Keep somewhere far above you. Although empty and seemingly uninhabited, the courtyard shows signs of maintenance; the hewn stone floors and walls meticulously dust, dirt and cobweb free. Dozens of smokeless oil lamps suspended from wrought iron poles embedded deep into the stone of the floor cast overlapping spheres of light that illuminate the entire courtyard brightly. Any sound made echoes faintly off the impossibly tall walls that create the inner curve of the crescent. The top of the inner wall is not visible, the grey of their stone fading into the grey of the indistinguishable ceiling. To the west, a tower-top is visible in the dim light of the upper regions of this peculiar fortress. At the western corner of the crescent is a doorway sealed with a thick, bloodsteel hinged steelwood door.   A giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st spaglen tier.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake (flying 45 feet above you), Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Nokin the Drake (flying 30 feet above you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

l
The area brightens.
[Steep Stairway.]

A feat of masonry genius, a staircase of giant, grey stone blocks spirals around and around the walls of the tower from the small entryway at the bottom of the tower all the way to  a narrow platform at the top of the tower where an archway leads into a room. Looking up or down from any point through the center of the staircase gives you a clear view of the dizzying drop awaiting someone careless enough to get too close to the unguarded outer edge of the stairs.  A steep stairway leading up and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Steep Stairway.]

A feat of masonry genius, a staircase of giant, grey stone blocks spirals around and around the walls of the tower from the small entryway at the bottom of the tower all the way to  a narrow platform at the top of the tower where an archway leads into a room. Looking up or down from any point through the center of the staircase gives you a clear view of the dizzying drop awaiting someone careless enough to get too close to the unguarded outer edge of the stairs. [Underground Courtyard.]

An uneasy silence fills this crescent shaped courtyard. Surrounding you are walls of smooth, dull grey stone carved out of the very foundation rock of the Keep somewhere far above you. Although empty and seemingly uninhabited, the courtyard shows signs of maintenance; the hewn stone floors and walls meticulously dust, dirt and cobweb free. Dozens of smokeless oil lamps suspended from wrought iron poles embedded deep into the stone of the floor cast overlapping spheres of light that illuminate the entire courtyard brightly. Any sound made echoes faintly off the impossibly tall walls that create the inner curve of the crescent. The top of the inner wall is not visible, the grey of their stone fading into the grey of the indistinguishable ceiling. To the west, a tower-top is visible in the dim light of the upper regions of this peculiar fortress. At the western corner of the crescent is a doorway sealed with a thick, bloodsteel hinged steelwood door.   A giant sigil etched bloodsteel portcullis and an open bloodsteel hinged steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Kalessin the Noble Drake, Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Nokin the Drake (flying 30 feet above you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A grate covers the spanse of floor leading from a heavily reinforced door to a steep, winding spiral staircase. Due to the damp conditions and dripping water, the bluesteel grate underfoot has long since lost its luster. A harsh wind blows upward through the grate, swirls around in the landing, and streams up the staircase. An eerie cacophony of moans and howls accompany the wind.  Some winding steps leading upward and an open bluesteel reinforced duskwood door are here.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A strong wind blows from the bottom of the winding stairs. Billowing capes and cloaks for any wearing such articles, the gusting air makes it difficult to hear anything other than its own mournful howling. Water drips from the ceiling high above, joining the luminiferous lichen clinging to the steps to make a perilous pathway.  Some winding steps leading downward and some winding steps leading upward are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian, Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian, Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 35 feet above you), Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Grysmor the Noble Secian, Nokin the Drake (flying 30 feet above you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

For anyone larger than a Hithual, this winding staircase would be a very tight fit. Tiny rodents with glowing red eyes scamper up and down the inner wall of the passage. [Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A grate covers the spanse of floor leading from a heavily reinforced door to a steep, winding spiral staircase. Due to the damp conditions and dripping water, the bluesteel grate underfoot has long since lost its luster. A harsh wind blows upward through the grate, swirls around in the landing, and streams up the staircase. An eerie cacophony of moans and howls accompany the wind.  Some winding steps leading upward and an open bluesteel reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying 25 feet below you), Starlyn the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Mieglyn the Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (flying 30 feet below you), Ying the Drake, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian, Rydareon the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Nokin the Drake (flying 10 feet below you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian, Kirrah the Noble Secian (flying 25 feet below you), Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake (flying 15 feet below you), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Linus the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.
Standing in this rank is:
Beauty, Faliarin, Raen, Everest, Starlyn, Mieglyn, Kiki, Binx, Ying, Ricochet, Julia, Rydareon, Draffut, Weldoian, Gwen, Mirrdae, Clara, Nokin, Verbaniah, Mikasi, Kavita, Silran, Kirrah, Glinka, Twilight, Bodhi, Raptorian, Feletia, Linus
>[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A grate covers the spanse of floor leading from a heavily reinforced door to a steep, winding spiral staircase. This room is illuminated.

>[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A grate covers the spanse of floor leading from a heavily reinforced door to a steep, winding spiral staircase. Due to the damp conditions and dripping water, the bluesteel grate underfoot has long since lost its luster. A harsh wind blows upward through the grate, swirls around in the landing, and streams up the staircase. An eerie cacophony of moans and howls accompany the wind.  Some winding steps leading upward and an open bluesteel reinforced duskwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Everest the Noble Secian (flying 95 feet above you), Kiki the Secian, Ricochet the Secian, and Kirrah the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Cramped Spiral Staircase.]

A strong wind blows from the bottom of the winding stairs. Billowing capes and cloaks for any wearing such articles, the gusting air makes it difficult to hear anything other than its own mournful howling. Water drips from the ceiling high above, joining the luminiferous lichen clinging to the steps to make a perilous pathway.  Some winding steps leading downward and some winding steps leading upward are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Small Laboratory.]

A single long stone table fills the center of the room, covered in vials, beakers and an assortment of unusual equipment. The smell in the room is a mix of sulfur, blood and a burning acidic reek. Small orbs of magefire hang in midair above the table, pulsing with an eldritch light. A locked crystalla fronted cupboard stands against one wall, filled with carefully labeled jars. Atop the cupboard is a small cage filled with glowing red-eyed rodents. [Small Laboratory.]

A single long stone table fills the center of the room, covered in vials, beakers and an assortment of unusual equipment. The smell in the room is a mix of sulfur, blood and a burning acidic reek. Small orbs of magefire hang in midair above the table, pulsing with an eldritch light. A locked crystalla fronted cupboard stands against one wall, filled with carefully labeled jars. Atop the cupboard is a small cage filled with glowing red-eyed rodents.   A tiny petrified wyvernbone skeleton, a small dark wooden rack of vials, a putrid yellow glass vial, a steaming chartreuse glass vial, a blood filled glass vial, an open short long shadowglass chest, an open hand carved duskwood trunk, a rune-inscribed gleaming obsidian archway, and an open large blackened duskwood trapdoor are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake's lifeless body, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (holding a glowing mysterious wand of light), Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Nokin the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Private Quarters.]

A narrow bed shoved against one wall is the only indication that this room might be anything other than a library dedicated to the study of magick and the races of dragon and wyvern. A tall set of shelves along one wall holds specimens and scrolls, and the large desk beneath the single window is covered with parchments and maps. Amidst the papers on the desk lie a few dark ovoid shapes, one that glistens wetly and could be the source of a low background humming noise. The back wall is lined with a row of hooks, from which hangs a the body of a young wyvern, possibly dead.  The head is marked with still glowing runes that have been burnt or carved into the scales.   Some dark grey granite stairs and a rune-inscribed gleaming obsidian archway are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st white hot magma sentinel.
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kiki the Secian, Ying the Drake's lifeless body, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Nokin the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake's lifeless body, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

[Private Quarters.]

A narrow bed shoved against one wall is the only indication that this room might be anything other than a library dedicated to the study of magick and the races of dragon and wyvern. A tall set of shelves along one wall holds specimens and scrolls, and the large desk beneath the single window is covered with parchments and maps. Amidst the papers on the desk lie a few dark ovoid shapes, one that glistens wetly and could be the source of a low background humming noise. The back wall is lined with a row of hooks, from which hangs a the body of a young wyvern, possibly dead.  The head is marked with still glowing runes that have been burnt or carved into the scales.   Some dark grey granite stairs and a rune-inscribed gleaming obsidian archway are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (holding a glowing mysterious wand of light), Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Nokin the Drake (flying beside you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake's lifeless body, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens.   A tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry, a large black obsidian table, a steaming red glass jar, a sealed clear glass jar, and some dark grey granite stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake's lifeless body, Kiki the Secian, Ying the Drake's lifeless body, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian, Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Ilivarr'a the Noble Dragon's lifeless body, Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

[Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens.   A tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry, a large black obsidian table, a steaming red glass jar, a sealed clear glass jar, and some dark grey granite stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake's lifeless body, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (holding a glowing mysterious wand of light), Ying the Drake's lifeless body, Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Rydareon the Drake, Draffut the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Nokin the Drake (flying beside you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Bodhi the Drake's lifeless body, Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

[Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens. [Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens.   A tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry, a large black obsidian table, a steaming red glass jar, a sealed clear glass jar, and some dark grey granite stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Grysmor the Noble Secian (holding a glowing finely woven silver mesh cage of fireflies), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake's lifeless body, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (holding a glowing mysterious wand of light), Ricochet the Secian, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian, Nokin the Drake, Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian, Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, Linus the Draco, and Helios the Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Tazanda'ar Keep, Passage]

A faint, but cold draft brushes against the back of your neck.  The stone stairway descends sharply, and even the brightest lanterns are barely able to give off enough light to penetrate into the depths of the keep.  The draft rustles the edge of a faded tapestry hanging behind an ancient statue on this landing.  A crumbling statue, some stone stairs going down, and a tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose) and Nokin the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious exits: None.

In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Grysmor the Noble Secian (holding a glowing finely woven silver mesh cage of fireflies), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (holding a glowing mysterious wand of light), Ricochet the Secian, Linus the Draco, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Mirrdae the Drake, Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Nokin the Drake (flying beside you), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Twilight the Noble Secian (holding a flaming massive dark blue wax candle), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

Raen's pupils dilate to their fullest, as tiny azure forks of magickal energy flare to life in his orbs.

Starlyn chuckles.

Ricochet asks, "how did we get to spur?"

Raen's fully dilated pupils are filled with arcing azure runemagick.

Linus just placed an enchanted delicate crystal spyglass within his open large leather backpack.

Raptorian pulls Kavita closer to him.

Raptorian holds Kavita close.

Julia holds Gwen close.

Twilight says to Ricochet, "Aye, And we shouldst go back for them."

Mirrdae says, "They can escape, ostensibly, through the ash arch."

Julia glances back griefstricken.

[Private Quarters.]

The dark grey granite walls and ceiling of this room are covered with soot where torches have been allowed to gutter out. Only one torch remains lit next to a stairway leading up. One large, thick-paned window overlooks a walled enclosure below, though the soot on the window prevents any clear view of what is down there. Across from the window, a bookcase filled with scrolls, tomes and jars reaches all the way to the ceiling.  A long worktable holds more scrolls and jars containing assorted specimens.   A tattered flame-embroidered runesilk tapestry, a large black obsidian table, a steaming red glass jar, a sealed clear glass jar, some dark grey granite stairs, and an arch of ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Mieglyn the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Beauty the Secian (holding a flaming magickal crackling spark), Faliarin the Draco, Raen the Draco, Everest the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing horn lantern), Starlyn the Noble Secian, Kiki the Secian, Binx the Noble Secian (holding a glowing mysterious wand of light), Ricochet the Secian, Linus the Draco, Julia the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Rydareon the Drake, Weldoian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing lantern), Clara the Secian (holding a glowing dove-etched moonsilver long-stemmed rose), Verbaniah the Secian (holding a glowing delicate red crystal rose), Mikasi the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Silran the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Kirrah the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Raptorian the Noble Secian, Feletia the Draco, and Helios the Draco.

info vis
                        You have visualized the following locations
                        -------------------------------------------

                                    Visualization #1 is:
The towering trees of the forest begin their ascension of the large mountain seen from the open plains of New South Lake. The root holds are precarious, as the mountain's face is especially steep on the northern side. The muddy path concludes in front of a sheer stone wall covered with verdant patches of green moss. A numbing breeze blows outward from the depths a massive cavern mouth, as if the mountain itself was exhaling ice-chilled breath. Deep-cut symbols grace the sides of the cavern entrance. They appear to be recently completed, as time, water, and weather have not yet dulled the sharp lines of the cuts.

                                    Visualization #2 is:
At the top of the steep hill, the magnificent landscape of the Silver Mountain stretches all around Crystal Snowflake Village, cradling the holiday town at its base. The path makes a sharp turn upwards along a stream, filled with icy chunks and flickering silver and gold fish. A few courageous Hithuals stand along the riverbank as they prepare to go ice diving.

                                    Visualization #3 is:
An abundant gallery of paintings depicting sacrifices and hold offerings to their god suspend from crooked iron nails. Resting beside each painting, cold black iron braziers appear to hold burned blood and bone. A few charred, blackened pieces can be found in them. Several iron chains hang along the walls of the sacrificial chamber. Along the floor, intricately placed colored slate tiles are coated in dust covered dried blood. Centering the room is a raised platform accessible through a flight of stairs. Upon this raised formation rests an altar inlaid with rows and rows of teeth. 

Your active visualization is #2

[Forest path.]

A wide, shallow sheet of water forms as two shallow streams join in the gully that accompanies the forest path. A kingfisher watches the shallows with hungered interest; several dragonflies skim the water, while water striders skate along the its surface. The soaring oak, ash, and pine trees do a fair, but not complete, job of blocking the jutting mountain to the south.

[Forest path.]

The shall stream that serves as the trail's guide is lazy, taking its time. The water murmurs softly to itself as it stumbles over mossy stones and slides beneath large sentinel oaks and pines. The season's leaves decorate the stream's ripples, their greens and browns dappled with shadow and the bit of light allowed to pass through the canopy.

This area is illuminated.

[Forest path.]

The forest path follows a muddy gully eroded by a shallow stream. Tall pine and oak trees tower above both sides of the muddy banks. Large mossy stones force the stream to twist and turn as it flows slowly south. The ground seems to be sloping downward slightly as the stream cuts back to the southeast.

[Forest path.]

The forest path requires constant twisting and turning to navigate undeterred through the obstacle course of fallen trunks, thick spider webs, and lush fern and ivy growth. Though not obvious at first glance, a game trail does indeed snake its way through the rotting leaves and pine needles that make up the padded forest floor. go bri
>[Bridge]

With Meetpoint at your heels this rugged old cobblestone bridge leads to the Southern Plains and the main trade routes from spur and Meetpoint to the Southernmost reaches of the lands. Signs that this road was once well traveled by the hustle and bustle of laden carts are plain to view. Though, with the hardened clay-like mud and the fact that it has not rained here in some time it is obvious that these tracks are very old.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south*.
n
go gate
>[Meetpoint gate.]

A few guards do a roving patrol of the area and down to the bridge. They check the caravans before they enter and anyone that looks suspicious they throw into the river. They seem quite wary of anyone coming or going to and from the city. From their appearance it would seem best to stay on their good sides and hope that they are in good moods.  An open large sturdy wooden gate, a stone bridge, and a floating pontoon bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.
[Meetpoint.]

Here a gate leads out of the fort and into the Southern regions. Several children run and play just inside the gate, under the watchful eyes of the guards. What was once a very well used trade route has slowed to some caravans bringing supplies for the townsmen and the occasional merchants traveling from the far southern reaches of the land. Many guards protect this section of the fort as it is home to some wild beasts that live outside these walls. In the distance, you can make out two more guards hunting the frogmen that often try to attack the city and caravans.  An open large sturdy wooden gate and a glowing wrought iron lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st human villager.

ne
>[Meetpoint Square.]

Within the heart of this proud fort one can see all around that the reconstruction of its buildings has begun. Large stones and logs have been stacked and piled, while some workers tirelessly attempt to repair the damage that occurred here during the Lords of Chaos wars. The buildings and homes of the people that resided here are slowly taking shape, though, far from completed. The smell of dyes, used to paint the town, permeate the area.  A breathtaking shimmering bouquet of moonflowers, an open light blue door, and a glowing wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast east* southeast southwest* west* northwest*.
[Meetpoint.]

Two guards patrol above the gate, looking you over carefully before giving leave to pass through the heavy wood gate. Thick and long wooden ladders serve up to the guard's posts high in the sky so that they may have some relief from their duties overlooking the land and city. Through the slates of the wooden walkways, you can make out four archers playing a game of cards, weapons at the ready. A whip cracks loudly as a caravan heads out the gate towards Spur.  An open wooden gate and a broken short bronze dagger are here.

[Southern Tradeway.]

The grass rises taller and taller in every direction further limiting view just off the roadside. A second glance reveals that this is the lowest point in a large, shallow depression. The tradeway sinks a little lower as it gets closer to the river off to the west. A ditch runs alongside the river's side of the road, small puddles of water filling the bottom. Trickles filter into the puddles from the grass beyond as mosquitoes dart across the muddy surfaces.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest* west northwest.
[Southern Tradeway.]

Only the well-built, stone tradeway gives any hint of civilization ever having had any presence here. The tall grasses limit visibility nearby, hiding any wildlife that may be waiting for prey to stumble too close. A few blades of grass sway slightly in the breeze, some of them broken by the passing of something heavy over them. One of the larger stones in the road, broken loose from its mortar, waits patiently to be repaired. 

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest* west northwest.
[Southern Tradeway.]

The stone paved tradeway stretches across the open plains, interrupting nature's task of consuming the land. An endless sea of grass surrounds you, lapping at the road much like the tides against a beach. The faintly damp wind occasionally blowing in from the west smells of earth. Some of the stones in the road interlock together to form the crude image of a lion. There is no discerning if it was done on purpose or sheer accident.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest* west northwest.
[Southern Tradeway.]

The tradeway runs across the open grasslands northeast towards the Spur, and southwest towards distant lands and eventually, the coast. The plains to the south and east seem totally indifferent to your existence. Just ahead, a small path moves up a village of huts spread out in a semi-circle. In the center of the village a giant fire pit sits where barbarians who wander through the village can sit around to stay warm.  A worn grassy path is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest* west northwest.
[Wilderness gate.]

Set within a wide tunnel leading through the hedge to the north is the Wilderness Gate. It separates the settled lands of Spur from the open plains to the south of the city. The plains stretch as far as the eyes can see, the horizon and the walls of the fort down the road the only blemishes of the grassy landscape in the distance. The stones of the road are smoothly set together, well built to withstand heavy travel. A broken wagon wheel, discarded some time ago, covers a spot of nearby grass, weeds trying to climb through the spokes.  An open bronze gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east southeast south southwest* west.

[Field.]

A broad strip of grassland that follows the main road east of you, this meadow is often used by the local aristocracy for picnicking and partying on good days. The city guardsmen keep the field clear of riffraff all year round, just to be safe.  A hole is here.

[Road.]

Even though it shows heavy wear, the road is in remarkably good repair. It was built by expert craftsmen to withstand the rigors of time and use. Evidence of recent repairs indicate that any problems are dealt with quickly and competently.  Some dried crimson streaks of blood and an open old wooden trash wagon are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south southwest*.
[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  An open iron gate and a rainbow silk tent are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south*.

Goods from the four corners of the world are offered for sale. In the corner draped with beautiful multicolored silks, a small booth has been erected.  A closed multicolored draped silk booth, a grey velvet curtain, and an exit are here.

>[South Gate.]

n

>[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed.  A street lantern, a closed morbius door, and an open black iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

Majestic elms continue to line this broad roadway, sheltering the avenue on both sides and further enhancing the grandiose atmosphere. Fronting the beautiful homes, cobbled paths edged with narrow flower beds meander through nearby private gardens. Though they appear wonderful places to spend an afternoon or take a picnic, the glances from those tending the estates makes it clear they are only for the invited.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* west*.
[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

>[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

>[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

>[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

>[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. [Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A street lantern and a gilded silver plaque are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.
>[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.
n
n
n
>[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, an open Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of closed silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.

n
[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern and a closed ruby-studded dragon-etched steel door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Rizz the Monitanian, Draffut the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian (seated), Raptorian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), and Mental the Psycian.

Rizz says in Monitanian, "bzy, iuxy oxvv"
[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a rosewood sign, a white snow drift, and a highly polished marble statue of a Dragon are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Aeyon the Noble Arachnian, Barracuda the Human, Grysmor the Noble Secian (seated and holding a glowing finely woven silver mesh cage of fireflies), Treyfalgar the Noble San Elf, Kiki the Secian (holding a glowing finely woven silver mesh cage of fireflies), Torrana the Psycian, Grau the Drag-al, Skar the Monitanian, Davide the Usil Elf, Maren the Noble Usil Elf, Swark the Monitanian, Anyah the Human, Mael the Thugian, and Earlyss the San Elf.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
